intro: Pavetta batesiana, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature.
